experience: You and Summer both know Leah Shanker, David McArthur, and 6 others
You both worked at Northern Arizona University
You both worked at Northern Arizona University from Sep 2007 to May 2009

Technical and managerial lead for a team of 6 software engineers and system administrators.Project technical lead for systems integration with central IAM initiatives. Systems Architect and consultant for campus departments and community partnership organizations.My team and I develop, support and maintain mission critical core services such as fully centralized DNS, DHCP, Metadirectory and Directory Services through LDAP, Web SSO, Federated SSO and MFA/2FA services for campus.Headliner projects I was responsible for:    (2015) Modernization of application risk analysis, vetting and credentialing policies and procedures for centralized management of LOA Implementation of basic Adaptive Authentication for applications based on user LOA and analysis of their connectivity details and device    (2014/2015) Re-architected and modernized Directory Service deployment using UnboundID. Directory services for the following:        i. Centralized Metadirectory for all NAU identities (~200,000 tracked users)        ii. Centralized authority for all web AuthN and AuthZ services (Web SSO, Federated SSO, etc.)        iii. Zone and host record attribute management for DNS/DHCP         iv. Name Services for all Oracle Databases         v. Real-time sender and recipient canonical repository for email gateway    (2014) Implementing MFA for security sensitive positions on campus Providing provisioning via strong-auth and out of band communication for self-service credentialing    (2011) Implementing fully automated DNSSEC deployment for all zones under our NAU.edu umbrella using ISC.org BIND DNS. Asked to speak at the ISC.org Open Day Confrence to detail our deployment success as one of the first Higher Ed entities to fully deeply DNSSEC and the only one to have the system fully automated.

A multi-platform full stack developer (C, C++, PERL, Java, .Net) focused on building middleware tools and services. Received multiple promotions working independently under general strategic direction. Frequently tapped as a formal project technical lead for solutions integrations.Headliner projects I was responsible for:(2007) Migrated university affiliate system into PeopleSoft and established PeopleSoft as the new central personRegistry; keeping the existing Metadirectory as the central identity repository to abstract the ERP from campus integrations.(2006) Implemented single email address/aliases for entire campus community; retiring multiple mail systems using LDAP as the realtime backend for sender/recipient canonical evaluation in the mail gateways.(2005) Developed an ISAPI Extension and Filter in C++ for MS IIS 6 to support CAS WEB SSO (later converted to .Net HttpModule and Java Servlet Filter). (2005) Converted most of the major campus web applications to use CAS Web SSO.(2004) Implemented "CAS Web SSO" integration for PeopleSoft. Was told that we were the first institution in the Higher Education space to attempt or complete this.(2004) Customized the WU-imapd server (developed in C) to support "CAS proxy ticket authentication" from our web based student portal, uPortal, mail channel.(2003) Developed a dynamic ETL engine for processing information from the PeopleSoft ERP into the centralized Personregistry and Metadirectory.(2003) Developed a dynamic web based GUI in .Net to display the LDAP schema and extended information for campus developers to use as a reference when looking to integrate with the central directory server. (2002) Developed custom SOAP server (wrapped with inetd) and associated services for automated provisioning/deprovisioning of Solaris 9 user accounts from a PERL based client firing on actions from the central LDAP based Metadirectory. Enabled PAM-LDAP and NSS_LDAP   for central user authentication.

Administered and maintained the organisation's information systems (UNIX and Win-NT) to ensure that they functioned reliably and in accordance with user needs (~25,000 users). Installed, configured, administered, and maintained OS and most complex information systems and associated hardware, in accordance with technical specifications, so that the organisation's information systems function reliably.  Communicated with system users; and investigated, trouble-shoot, and resolved system problems so that user problems are resolved quickly and satisfactorily.Focused mainly on automating account provisioning, PAM-LDAP integration, Solaris 8/9 administration. Also Functioned as a backup Win-NT administrator for
Studied semiconductor fabrication and MEMS.Interned with Central IT as a Unix/Solaris Systems Administrator.
Studied semiconductor fabrication and MEMS.Interned with Central IT as a Unix/Solaris Systems Administrator.
Young Adult LGBT Support Group Facilitator (weekly)

As a group moderator and facilitator I support transgender youth who are in the process of, or considering, transition. We are heavily based in WPATH.org standards of care and we work to insure that attendees are living healthy and being realistic in their life choices. Much as a life coach, I Individually I help people navigate the complex path of obtaining legal correction of name and gender.

summary: I am a systems architect with a strong emphasis in Identity and Access Management (IAM) coming from a background in full stack web development and enterprise systems administration. I have focused much of my career in management of next gen middleware and core identity services such as: Federated SSO, Metadirectory (Identity Repositories), LDAP, DNS, DHCP. I tend to see myself as a bit of a futurist in the IAM area and work to bring bleeding edge ideas to implementation.
name: Summer Steddom
title: Middleware and IAM Technical Lead - NAU
